title: Yasuo is extremely weak to ranged harass
body:
You have skillshots? Let me just dash through my minions

You have another skillshot? I'll just Windwall that

You hit something? I have a shield to mitigate that

You want to fight me when I'm low? Let me just crit you three times in a row

replies.body: lol git good at tossing skill shots OVER the wall, scrub
{{champion:45}} YOU CALLED?! HAHAHAHAAA
Correct me if im wrong but you can wind wall his ult no?
Dark Matter
Wait so you can or not?
Yeah, you can Wind Wall both Q and R. W still goes over, though.
W isn't a real spell bro.
Makes me sad, too. You opponent has to d/c for you to hit it lol.
this is what i needed lmao ty.

he can't dash through his own minions, the windwall has a cooldown of around 15 sec. ish, just bait it out with a lower damage skillshot, or use a skill that isn't one, auto attacks proc the shield, just auto him wait like 1.5 sec. and unleash what you want, build hp or armor in your build, or you can play malzahar, and he wrecks yasuo
Vel'Koz also gives Yasuo an impressively hard time.
I didn't see this when I replied, but yeah. I love facing Yas as Vel. My Q has a very short cooldown, and my auto-attacks are not projectiles. Also if he dives me, drop E on myself. Problem solved.
Wait, Yas W doesnt stop Vel's AA? That's cool. AD Vel FTW.

Nobody expects AD Vel.

*Nobody.*

Also, he has my favourite crit animation in the entire game.  I did AD Vel'Koz in a joke game with friends once, and had a lot of fun with it.  I've tried it a few times since, but still prefer AP Vel.

My main problem with Vel into Yas is that Yas's Wind Wall blocks Vel's W (Void Rift).  If THAT is what Riot calls a projectile, then I have a lot of questions about how this game is coded.

I play that frequently, not as a joke.

If they didn't want him to be an ADC, he wouldn't have a special critical hit animation.

Agreed.

I wonder if it's possible to do a hybrid build... I know hybrid builds aren't as strong due to penetration, but it could be fun.

{{item:3146}} {{item:3046}} {{item:3115}} {{item:3124}} {{item:3078}} {{item:3158}} ?

Well, it has a skillshot indicator, takes time to move from one point to another, and does damage accordingly.

If that isn't a projectile, I dunno what is.

No, your minions are his minions when you face him. He has a field day inside of your waves. 

Malzahar also wrecks every assassin.

You are supposed to aa to hit the shield, wait a couple of sec and then throw your skillshots.... Most Yasuos will start dashing once their shield is broken, either towards you or to run away, that is the point when you can intercept him
He also has the worst base stats out of every melee champion in the game

> [{quoted}](name=WlND WALL,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Jv6FEJyr,comment-id=0013,timestamp=2015-09-11T23:14:38.577+0000)
>
> He also has the worst base stats out of every melee champion in the game

But that's okay, he's compensated for it by having 30 passives and no cooldowns.
Only Yasuo mains will find room to complain about a champion _only_ having infinite 0.1 second cooldown dashes that also do AoE damage.

They... don't do Aoe damage.

He doesn't stay alive forever like some champs.

The only reason anyone is complaining now is because they somehow forgot about the juggernauts and want to target the only fighter in the game who can't rely on items to make him tanky and needs his wind wall and mobility instead.

Doesn't Yasuo synergize really well with items though, and his late game is just button spashingly good?

People target Yasuo because he's unfun and the very few weaknesses he has (like vulnerable to ranged harass like all melee champions) are totally negated by his kit to the point where he doesn't have any really  weak matchups or many hard counters. Even if you suck and feed you can just wait till you hit late game.
There are tons of them, just scroll up.

What are his weaknesses? He's squishy and melee? He has infinite gap closers on a 0.1 second cooldown, a wall that blocks everything but a Ziggs ultimate, and instead of mana he gets a free shield. "hur dur yasuoooz sheeld is soo bad" well at least he has a shield, most other champions have mana.

He thrives against kiting MAGES.

Dianna, talon, zed, etc

He has counters. Yasuo has a high skillcap(don't even debate this point) and he does have weaknesses.  Mobile champions like ekko do ok against yasuo and so do LONG range mages like xerath and velkoz. Stop whining and start playing properly.

He thrives against most champions in general, but if you're playing against him with a champion who has any skill shots then you just don't exist during the laning phase. He has counters sure, but not many. He invalidates most Mid laners and even makes Ahri (Who also counters hard) look unsafe.

You still refuse to read and learn... I can dea with yasuos even playing Vel'koz. How? Becuase I know what he can and can't do plus when to attack him.
 I guess you ignored my last post whcich gave youa ctaul feedback for the same reason: Refusing to Learn.
Refusing to learn what? I know Vel'koz is good against Yasuo and I know other champions are too, but it still doesn't excuse his very low amount of counters and very low amount of weaknesses.
If that was true he would have a 55%+ winrate

Vel'koz is a bit of an issue. While he has one of the only skillshots in the game that can be fired around the wall, he's also the only champion in the game who only has one ability the wall can't block.

His dashes are predictable, especially if he is doing his usual "dash through minions to enemy-hit him with Q-dash back"
Windwall has high cd and does not block most spells(Malzahar completely ignores the wall for example)
Shield can be broken with a single AA
His crit chance is not 100% until he finishes his Static+IE

Obviously, if Yasuo player is stronger than you-he will win, but if you are equals-you have fine chances to win

> [{quoted}](name=Posui Gart,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Jv6FEJyr,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-09-11T10:40:39.964+0000)
>
> His dashes are predictable, especially if he is doing his usual "dash through minions to enemy-hit him with Q-dash back"
> Windwall has high cd and does not block most spells(Malzahar completely ignores the wall for example)
> Shield can be broken with a single AA
> His crit chance is not 100% until he finishes his Static+IE
> 
> Obviously, if Yasuo player is stronger than you-he will win, but if you are equals-you have fine chances to win

I stopped reading at most spells bypass windwall.

> [{quoted}](name=DanofDemacia,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Jv6FEJyr,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-09-11T11:36:26.712+0000)
>
> I stopped reading at most spells bypass windwall.

Yeah the windwall block alot of spels because they are considered projectiles. Even ones that shouldn't really count....
Draven's ult for example, is digging through the ground, not flying in the air. 
Braums ult is blocked too....wtf?
Vel'Koz's Void Rift (W) is blocked, as is Viktor's Death Ray.  Since when are lasers or rifts in the ground projectiles?  O_o

> [{quoted}](name=RasCaelestis,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Jv6FEJyr,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2015-09-12T06:18:23.007+0000)
>
> Vel'Koz's Void Rift (W) is blocked, as is Viktor's Death Ray.  Since when are lasers or rifts in the ground projectiles?  O_o

yet windwall doesn't block Vel-koz'z laser?
Also Vel'Koz's W isn't just a rift in the ground (like cho gath's) he launches some form of projectile at the ground and it erupts

None of Malz's skills are missiles. He has 2 ground effects and a point-n-click with no travel time. Other ground effects include Syndra's Q, Cho'gath's Q, Zyra's Q, Brand's E, etc.

 Ground effects that travel, like Zyra's E roots or Vel'koz's E fissure, will be blocked. Logic be damned.

Just you try and roll a plastic ball into a high-powered fan. 

It's still going to get blown back, even with constant ground contact.

{{champion:1}} 

Wind does nothing but fan the flames.

Well, you can always take out his Passive with one Basic Attack; and the WindWall ... well, it was almost 30 seconds cooldown early game if I'm not mistaken, and a SkillShot doesn't have that much. About the dash, you can't do anything, but it isn't impossible to hit him.
About the critical strike ... you can't do anything, same as Tryndamere. But he also need itens, and while he doesn't have that, you can take the chance. Also he just can Ulti Knock Up Targets, and his 3Q is a bit easy to avoid unless he use E + Q, but usually when you see he's going to get the 2 Stack, you get way from him.
Yasuo is strong, but I don't agree with people that say he is just impossible to face. Even the new Randuin's is a great item for use against him.
oh boy a half hourly QQ about Yasuo thread. git gud scrub.
Just a question. can his wall block ori's ball? (Q  i mean)

I think it can but it cannot block Morde's Siphon of Destruction forward-cone.

 I'm  like ... wtf?

> [{quoted}](name=TapSomeBong,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Jv6FEJyr,comment-id=001c,timestamp=2015-09-12T07:27:42.947+0000)
>
> Just a question. can his wall block ori's ball? (Q  i mean)
I think it used to just teleported back to you when it touched, but it got changed so now it can't go threw the windwall "Getting stuck on it Most of the time".
not sure about annie. but in my experience some ppl who wreck yas are {{champion:63}} {{champion:127}}
Annie is probably his hardest counter next to {{champion:92}} tbh
